modules.description: This module provides a command-line parsing function `main` that initializes HTTP clients and passes them to a given handler. It works with lists of command-line arguments, HTTP client modules, and Lwt promises. Concrete use cases include building command-line tools that interact with HTTP services, such as querying or modifying remote data stores via LDP (Linked Data Platform).

This module handles command-line argument parsing and HTTP client initialization for building tools that interact with HTTP services. It accepts command-line arguments, configures HTTP clients, and runs asynchronous operations via Lwt promises. Key operations include setting up client configurations, dispatching HTTP requests, and handling responses in LDP-compatible systems. Example uses include command-line clients for querying or updating remote data stores over HTTP.
